situation.title: Courts

content.processed:
Rules and Recommendations

The courts continue functioning even in times of emergency, but it's necessary to follow the general rules, especially to observe hygienic measures (wear a face mask, social distance, and disinfect your hands), give priority to written communication, and follow the rules of conduct in the courthouse.

Court proceedings take place as usual. 

The public may be present at the trial but must wear a face mask at all times. This will protect themselves and others in the courtroom.

When visiting the courts, it is necessary to follow increased hygienic measures - the court building can only be entered after prior hand disinfection. At the entrance to the courthouse, you may be asked to provide a statement that you do not have an infectious disease, fever, or symptoms of respiratory disease (especially coughing, sneezing, breathing difficulties).

It is necessary to wear a face mask in the court building at all times. Exceptions to the obligation to wear a face mask at the time of court proceedings apply to judges and jurors, public prosecutors, the accused, their lawyer, hearing participants and their representatives, witnesses, court experts, translators, and other persons for whom the court allows not to wear a face mask.

Inspection of the files is possible only in necessary cases (e.g. if the statutory deadline was missed or in the case of ordered proceedings) and after prior agreement.

Prefer written or electronic communication with the courts. An online data-box can also be used to communicate with the courts.

Specific courts can take their own measures, which can be found on the website of a specific court.
